meanings.definition: To stain (a tissue or specimen) with a color contrasting with that of the principal stain.
meanings.sent1: The scientist carefully counterstained the tissue sample to highlight specific structures.
meanings.sent2: She counterstained the slide to make the details more visible under the microscope.
meanings.sent3: The tissue felt like it was playing dress-up when it got counterstained in bright pink.
meanings.sent4: His memories were counterstained with nostalgia, like old photographs in a new album.
meanings.sent5: The colors of the counterstained tissue popped out like a rainbow on a cloudy day.

meanings.sent1: The counterstained slide stood out among the others in the collection.
meanings.sent2: She admired the counterstained glass artwork for its unique beauty.
meanings.sent3: The room looked like a party with all the counterstained decorations.
meanings.sent4: His tie was counterstained red, making a bold statement at the event.
meanings.sent5: The counterstained flowers in the garden added a vibrant touch to the landscape.
